task.title: Viewing a message hub by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can view endpoints, connection policies, messaging policies, and message hubs by using the list, and show commands on the command line.

context.p: You can view a message hub by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to view a message hub, see .
context.note: The commands must be capitalized as shown.

choices.choice: To view a list of all endpoints, enter the following command: list Endpoint

To view a specific endpoint, enter the following command: show Endpoint "Name=name"where:
name Specifies the name of the endpoint you want to view.
To view a list of all connection policies, enter the following command: list ConnectionPolicy

To view a specific connection policy, enter the following command: show ConnectionPolicy "Name=name"where:
name Specifies the name of the connection policy you want to view.
To view a list of all messaging policies, enter the following command: list MessagingPolicy

To view a specific messaging policy, enter the following command: show MessagingPolicy "Name=name"where:
name Specifies the name of the messaging policy you want to view.
To view a list of all message hubs, enter the following command: list MessageHub

To view a specific message hub, enter the following command: show MessageHub "Name=name"where:
name Specifies the name of the message hub you want to view.

taskbody.example: This example shows the details of a specific message hub, testHub: show MessageHub "Name=testHub" Name = testHub Description = A test message hub.
